title: Enhancing Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving Competencies Through Productive Failure

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary calculus, linear algebra, and statistics
context.additional_context: A course for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to cultivate problem-solving skills for complex mathematical tasks required in actual work

learning_goals: Learners can creatively apply three or more non-Euclidean approaches to solve complex mathematical problems.
Learners can identify and correct 80% or more of logical errors occurring during team-based problem-solving processes.
Learners can convert and explain problem-solving strategies using graphic representations into five distinct types.

resources: BYOD-Compatible Online Collaboration Platform (Google Jamboard, Miro)
Digital Quiz System for Formative Assessment

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
